metadata.title: CVE-2017-5054 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 57.0.2987.133 forLinux, Windows, and Mac, and 57.0.2987.132 for Android, allowed a remoteattacker to obtain heap memory contents via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu2.1350').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
